column4: Did you do a crc check on the disc, assuming it's an Ubuntu iso?
What could be wrong is a corrupt cd, or a faulty cd-rom drive.
this is the second CD..the first one had the same mistake, and the cd-rom drive should actually be fine, hang on, i'll try another drive
same error with another drive :-/ and it's the second CD. burnt the first one with maximum speed, and this one with 8x.
how do i do that? :)
Boot off the cd, there's a cd check in the menu.. should be anyways, assuming you have the desktop version.
Or what guntbert referenced.
when i do the check of the cd, i get the same error like trying to install :O
Oh dear, sounds like you need to go the md5checksum route then :/
the md5sums are the same. what am i doing wrong here :S
Sounds like your drive might be on the fritz.
Um, or possibly your drives don't like your cd-rs..
could be the drive with which i am burning the cd :S could i compare the burnt cd somehow?
Could be that, sure.
is there a way to check the burnt cd?
I'm fresh out of ideas, short of a) finding different cd-rs to burn to and.or burning the iso with another drive (at slowest speed).
should i burn the CD, Disc-At-Once or Track-At-Once?
Disc-at-once.
Be sure to close the session.
okay. i'll try to burn on another pc.
aw god. now i was burning the cd on another notebook. the software got stuck at the end. so i rebooted and took out the cd. and of course it doesnt work :( the 3rd useless CD-R today.
Not your lucky day it seems :/
can i "uniso" the iso with winrar, and burn it onto a DVD-RW? (i dont want to burn another CD-R) or do i need a special boot sector file or something?
